Currently structures are small by design, but this could change.

I feel like this and the jungle temple should definitely have an overhaul on looks, uses and mechanics. Maybe make them more dungeon like with a few randomly generated room’s interconnected to add more risk for the rewards available. The desert temple could have buried rooms that you have to excavate out to get to a loot room so it’s not just a easy hole to drop down in.
The jungle temple could have the same premise but maybe it could have more of a maze and red stone contraptions to try to trap players to make the structures feel more lively. We’ve had updates adding new structures but I really believe what you could do next is overhaul some of the existing structures that have been in the game almost untouched. Adding more complexity to the structures could help inspire more creativity in players builds too
pyramids are fine as they are
It's also worth making suspicious blocks minable with Silk Touch, we still need a brush to unearth the contents, but now we can use a brush in our base.
You should also be able to place something in the red sand.

I do like this idea. Maybe they can be a seed ya plant in tilled soil and have 3 stages at which they can be harvested. stage one could be a small bud that emits a 3x3 block radius of light, Stage two would be a small stem that emits up to 5x5 block radius of light and finally the 3rd stage where it would emit a 8x8-10x10 radius of light now being in a full blossom showing it's natural beauty. Once you harvest it you can put them anywhere like on the ceiling hanging off of it like a vine to the walls and floors!

My idea is to be able to light the torchflower with a fire as its a torch flower and for it to give off some sort of ambience a lot like how the spore blossom or the Fireflies would give off a glow and particles but for this fire to not be permanent it could simply last maybe 2 minecraft days but when it rains the flowers fire would go out. This could give a very low light level or could give a high one I thought it could be cool if it gave off a light level depending on durability and what it was lit by so lets say its lit by a lava source it will give a light level of 9 or 13 but if its given by a really weak durability flint n steel it would give off a light level of 1 or 2. I think it would be cool to give a torchflower more uses. Also I think since its ancient and it's rare to get it could be cool if it gave a function to get rid of sculk on the ground as it would slowly but surely push it out but let's say sculk tries to grow in whatever is in the torch flowers radius the sculk cant grow on,

Had the exact same thought. It gives Domesticating Sniffers use in gathering torchflower seeds. And it allows homes/bases to have more natural decorations instead of a million torches everywhere to keep mobs away. Make the torchflower work like torches!!

Mojang may wish to remove light emitting functionality but still keep the idea of glowing armor trims if they add this. As an alternative to the idea, I'd also like to suggest that making your armor trim glow instead makes the enchantment glint only apply to the trim pixels.
yes but make it so that you have to use a glow ink plus trims to craft Glowing armors trims
I don't think they would actually glow, just appear brighter like the enchantment glint.
Finally, a decent use for glow ink! This would look super cool. It shouldn't emit light imo, but I would take anything to give glow ink a better use lol

(Note this is in MY opinion. opinions are to be debated.) If I where to redesign the creative inventory I would try to add changes that don't have multiple blocks/items in different tabs.


•  Group up Building Blocks and Colored Blocks.   I like the idea of sorting blocks by colors and variations but I really don't think it necessary to be in 2 tabs. So Keep the Building blocks as is and put the color blocks at the bottom.
•  Combined Natural Blocks and Functional Blocks and rename it Decoration blocks.   This will have all the blocks that don't have variations, having slabs/stairs or are colorable, AND will have blocks that do stuff like crafting table, beacon, ect.
•  Sorting the 2 tabs I changed: Move all the Shulker Boxes, Beds, Candles, and Banner to Decoration blocks. Move the coal block, gold block, etc to Decoration blocks as well all the iron stuff.
•  Time for Redstone tab!  Move ALL of these to Decoration blocks; Chest, Wool, Amethyst Block, Red Ore, Big Dripleaf, barrel, Composter, Bell, Armor Stand. Move every single door, button, pressure plate, Gate, Trapdoor to Redstone. This will make Building Blocks way less overcrowded and hopefully get people used to the Redstone tab.
•  Sort the Enchanted books back into the Combat, Tools & Utilities tabs. Sort the Enchantments to there respected tabs
Exp: Knockback and Thorns goes into Combat or Silk Touch and Lure goes into Tools & Utilities
the exemptions being Mending, Unbreaking, and the Curses, they can go in both.
Personally, I think it's an interesting idea, but it belongs in a mod.
Great idea!

I personally think this system is something similar to this would be an amazing alternative to coordinates! Right now, the only really good way to mark a place is with coordinates or a map/lodestone. Coordinates mean you bring up this invasive debug menu that you can't rebind, and a map only works when you know the direction you're facing (more f3 screen). Plus, the whole nsew and chunk alignment are really unintuitive for new players. Fine, then let's just use lodestones. WRONG. A lodestone coats A NETHERITE INGOT. Most players would rather click a button to use f3. On top of all of that, both maps and lodestones are items, susceptible to being lost in lava or chests and take up valuable inventory space. This solution would be
A. Universal (all players automatically have access to the same stars)
B. Intuitive (following the stars is something we've been doing for all of history)
C. Unobtrusive (doesn't cover your screen or take up inventory space)
D. Immersive (it's not a debug menu and I don't have to worry about chunk alignment)
Really cool idea
This is such a cool idea if this would be added we would just need ships to the sea

the recipe for the star chart is something i hadn't really considered, locking it behind a cartographer would just make villagers Even More useful, i personally imagined them as being a darker color than maps so maybe it'd be a map and black dye? or maybe even a new use for coals (since you could be coating a map in coal and then scratching the constellations into it)? maybe this feature could have a more whimsical and magical side to it by allowing you to catch shooting stars and then use those for star charts?
